E4FEC0EB97B64BF2AEB5B1ADB23CDDCB.description: Schreib vier Sätze auf Deutsch über das Foto

85E6530B6B124ED181D8E736C27A7464.description: Du musst ungefähr 150 Wörter auf Deutsch schreiben. Schreib etwas über beide Punkte der Aufgabe.

E54CDA6B4FD44225ADE8BF6DE3750F59.description: Du musst ungefähr 90 Wörter auf Deutsch schreiben. Scheib etwas über alle Punkte der Aufgabe.

9425C4C6472044638F15EA429580DFDF.description: Du musst ungefähr 40 Wörter auf Deutsch schreiben.

399D6CC294FE46AD847911CC567C6960.description: Wähle die richtige Aktivität und schreib den Buchstaben ins Kästchen.

B10B3CEBD1624C7E9C530A33EAA34343.description: Schreib R, wenn die Aussage richtig ist, F, wenn die Aussage falsch ist, NT, wenn die Aussage nicht im Text ist.

6E9B98FBA74C4576AF445D4C5B5C9E56.description: Schreib den richtigen Buchstaben ins Kästchen

360F740D56C143FDB8812B5801E6026E.description: Hör das folgende Gespräch/die folgende Diskussion/das folgende Interview/den folgenden Bericht.

07E717506561426F9B9B52CAE4570961.description: Für eine negative Meinung, schreib N, für eine positive Meinung, schreib P, für eine positive und negative Meinung, schreib P + N.

FEDDAC12E6094FF789D7F36D98B78CD0.description: Füll die Tabelle auf Deutsch aus

8A244598112E454CBF99A588C1F2B159.description: Es ist welche Person? Schreib den Namen ins Kästchen.

8909D5AF902C4518BCD714C796413D8C.description: Erwähne einen positiven Aspekt/einen Vorteil/ einen negativen Aspekt/einen Nachteil.

BC2BA6B3F5FA408EB58A26738E0F63E1.description: Ergänze den folgenden Text mit jeweils einem Wort von der Liste unten.

87583DC4C7B447BD81CB5DF14A3CEF7D.description: Beantworte die beiden Teile der Frage.

99797C81C14440298D7769D3AB8EB5F9.description: Achtung! Du kannst die Buchstaben mehr als ein Mal benutzen.

947C8CDF87E2443E9D0767DCC9CCF41B.description: Using a word which refers to a similar item

562A44CF8CBD458C8398340797FEAA2C.description: the primary stress pattern of words such as Garage, Sandale

DFC422E38DFB4F839DC6A0175D5D33BD.description: the consonant 'k' in English is often a soft c in German (eg Milch, Flasche)

1F5E52C5DB9D444B84031EE7B13623A9.description: voiced consonants at the end of words in English are often devoiced in German (eg Bart, Bett, Pfund, Gold)

AA35E41869174269990FC16D99940D8A.description: the primary stress pattern of words such as Atom, Energie, Präsident, Elektrizität

0E1D3123B8214752BE5A37D3107FFC3A.description: the characteristic pronunciation of -tion in words such as Station, Nation

140EE389687140A3B12EFECC133B157E.description: Using common patterns between German and English

3815DF311E684435954283E8C60B4844.description: Students will also be expected to understand words which meet the above criteria, but which differ slightly in their written form in German (eg Adresse, Knie).

F1F18B803E3249319597F46EDD17752D.description: There are many words which have exactly the same form, and essentially the same meaning, in German and in English (eg Museum, Hand, Name). When such words occur in a context and students can be expected to understand them in English and German.

5C3A2B4BD56D48A78697F5C489643959.description: Knowledge of patterns of word formation in German can help to understand a text.

78764D48FACD4AE18DA132618023B4A5.description: Another aid to the drawing of correct inferences is for students to bear in mind that there are regularities in the real world which make it possible to anticipate what people may say or write about it. The ability to predict occurrences in the real world makes it possible to anticipate words, and their meaning, in a given context. This is one reason why it is important for a German course to develop awareness and understanding of countries and communities where German is spoken.

2C1F331D88CA4AFBBB635D5C7879FED3.description: Making use of the social and cultural context

00963A8C59264E2196090E97AB5C87BD.description: Students will be helped to master all these strategies if, when reading and listening, they learn to use such clues as the plural forms of nouns and verbs, the way verbs change to form tenses, word order and other such features to help them recognise to which category (verb, noun, adjective etc) an unknown word belongs. This can be a considerable help in making intelligent guesses about the meaning of the word.

64FE6F8692E94EF19184261C73D2714D.description: Making use of grammatical markers and categories

06FA29B8BF804CE09DD98ED854B5D76E.description: When reading and listening, students can learn to infer the meaning of new words from the verbal context.

341989769AD24FBD98ABCEC677DE1121.description: The skilled reader can find many clues about the purpose and content of a text from a study of the layout, the title, the length, the typeface and any related pictures.

8BAA6FC20B1940EB989E39C94FBBE044.description: Using the visual and verbal context

001ABFAF79594CD99BBA0DA55C0F81BA.description: Many tasks contain words which are not essential for an understanding of the main points of the text. What is important in the text is often presented more than once, in different ways: the student may not understand a point in one form of words and understand it fully in another.

AF6BADD3D5454714BD997D1DEF37E951.description: Ignoring words which are not needed

4E6B5E81903B4234BAD5F80EC0324E54.description: use of seit with imperfect tense

6B98D200535A4A17BA7364CACB875524.description: with genitive (most common eg außerhalb, statt, trotz, während, wegen)

BB3A5E90097E4E1AB6B6DFCDA39D5DD9.description: imperfect subjunctive in conditional clauses: haben and sein.

F8633F8DB7D4445C9E350C96C357A49D.description: modal: imperfect subjunctive of können, sollen

3C626FC7C91643A8BB60BB702CB15D2E.description: infinitive constructions (ohne…zu…; um…zu…); verbs with zu… eg beginnen, hoffen, versuchen

ABAB507FAF8D4AF59D8011D59CDB7DC9.description: relative: all cases, and use of was

F798A500E1164C6182D6CA3A1EAD3ABE.description: adjectival endings after etwas, nichts, viel, wenig, alles

E9B6AD051FC94D83BA74A75A442A28B3.description: including use of seit with present tense

CAFBEFC244BC47CD8714E0A0EC3D8592.description: subordinating (most common eg als, obwohl, weil, wenn)

66AC0AD6570E4B9DA5579B13A74C205F.description: coordinating (most common eg aber, oder, und)

3ED481036F664DECAF2BEF23BEC6670F.description: fixed case and dual case with accusative and/or dative

914611FE6AC24A169993F90AF884B21D.description: imperfect/simple past: haben, sein and modals

21CF7A18662E45B8B93610A660D10597.description: modal: present and imperfect tenses, imperfect subjunctive of mögen

49DA25051E554E02AA3FF0DDA1721DF8.description: impersonal (most common only eg es gibt, es geht, es tut weh)

AC22AFBBE00C4CB99509F7AF0844816C.description: relative: other cases (R) and use of was (R)

080550A540024FF6BFA137BADE42F785.description: sehr, zu, viel, ganz, ziemlich, ein wenig, ein bisschen

80EC9DAF82554F5D88F6198C647DEDC8.description: common adverbial phrases (ab und zu, dann und wann, letzte Woche, nächstes Wochenende, so bald wie möglich)

C351B73976F5463F92302A1BD67F874F.description: adverbs of time and place (manchmal, oft, hier, dort)

B03C2A1345BF4FF2B6EBD006818B9F16.description: interrogative (wann, warum, wo, wie, wie viel)

B21C2E9A2FFF4F7F882EE36877F00A82.description: comparative and superlative, including common irregular forms (besser, lieber, mehr)

1F7465CC95504EC18F5D19B0336CA95B.description: comparative and superlative, including common irregular forms (besser, höher, näher)

FED18D8FB16A4482AB069D656A3A252E.description: adjectival endings after etwas, nichts, viel, wenig, alles (R)

1BB260E3D97B4828B03FF19BAE0EA5C6.description: adjectival endings: predicative and attributive usage, singular and plural, used after definite and indefinite articles, demonstrative and possessive adjectives

18026000EAD145CE9C072E33A69830DE.description: weak nouns: nominative and accusative singular (Herr, Junge, Mensch, Name) (R)

80577DC24B7A4651B0C88F244E523D0F.description: singular and plural forms, including genitive singular and dative plural

65A092BEBC2048A4944BD5311F5B3777.description: translate sentences and short texts from English into German to convey key messages accurately and to apply grammatical knowledge of language and structures in context.

35FAC2BFF6BE4EFF8711523CB3E0C3CB.description: make independent, creative and more complex use of the language, as appropriate, to note down key points, express and justify individual thoughts and points of view, in order to interest, inform or convince

CCD8E473B62844F18A7A94A36A18B966.description: manipulate the language, using and adapting a variety of structures and vocabulary with increasing accuracy and fluency for new purposes, including using appropriate style and register

767B5A2FCE9C4AE8882203526EB27CB1.description: make accurate use of a variety of vocabulary and grammatical structures, including some more complex forms, to describe and narrate with reference to past, present and future events

4BDC3A79D20D4487975BA4A3F2B3BBA2.description: produce clear and coherent text of extended length to present facts and express ideas and opinions appropriately for different purposes and in different settings

07D976455A7646BFB6D051B59CB4C8EE.description: write short texts, using simple sentences and familiar language accurately to convey meaning and exchange information

75F930AB2C274BD682C60C418B6ACCDE.description: communicate effectively in writing for a variety of purposes across a range of specified contexts

34F0CE6393AE43439C1F94BBFBB7E26B.description: translate a short passage from German into English.

769A708929D44A9282F8DA96839FEF58.description: demonstrate understanding by being able to scan for particular information, organise and present relevant details, draw inferences in context and recognise implicit meaning where appropriate

4D6C95F21AC744F39858465B5850C93C.description: recognise and respond to key information, important themes and ideas in more extended written text and authentic sources, including some extracts from relevant abridged or adapted literary texts

9EAED642BC6D497DA8AD00F4127ABF88.description: deduce meaning from a variety of short and longer written texts from a range of specified contexts, including authentic sources involving some complex language and unfamiliar material, as well as short narratives and authentic material addressing a wide range of relevant contemporary and cultural themes

1AF34FE47BD24C46BFB2E2E34AD970F6.description: identify the overall message, key points, details and opinions in a variety of short and longer written passages, involving some more complex language, recognising the relationship between past, present and future events

1E75A66FB8AE4863AA1E25FD7052BE6D.description: understand general and specific details within texts using high frequency familiar language across a range of contexts

568D66729A97425A9615ABF873A93A21.description: understand and respond to different types of written language

2E21FFE5D3E240F18D6B1E0D293D37E9.description: Reading: Understand and Respond to Written Language

012FCC3A65D74171B4BBEC17239C452E.description: use accurate pronunciation and intonation such as to be understood by a native speaker.

A2A64C8569534C4F8BAF3D56CEF85D1D.description: make creative and more complex use of the language, as appropriate, to express and justify their own thoughts and points of view

15498C7DDC11421D993F37D836FC687C.description: make appropriate and accurate use of a variety of vocabulary and grammatical structures, including some more complex forms, with reference to past, present and future events

66694D812E144022AF9F6B51D8DA6BDD.description: initiate and develop conversations and discussion, producing extended sequences of speech

DB45E77B89E5457C89DC6C9A72CA5D9B.description: speak spontaneously, responding to unexpected questions, points of view or situations, sustaining communication by using rephrasing or repair strategies, as appropriate

6D859F0CCBBC4E6EA803A07B14F50266.description: convey information and narrate events coherently and confidently, using and adapting language for new purposes

D235BD89B92641A8BB8070C19C2F6749.description: take part in a short conversation, asking and answering questions, and exchanging opinions

DBBB04C872B046BE96BC32DD49664388.description: communicate and interact effectively in speech for a variety of purposes across a range of specified contexts

D6B7DAD20B184A1E8168C31EE023C8EE.description: Speaking: Communicate and Interact in Speech

52B7500723C447F9A2507DC3166216DB.description: recognise and respond to key information, important themes and ideas in more extended spoken text, including authentic sources, adapted and abridged, as appropriate, by being able to answer questions, extract information, evaluate and draw conclusions.

10168F85C9444FCDA0E67ED2E5158182.description: deduce meaning from a variety of short and longer spoken texts, involving some complex language and more abstract material, including short narratives and authentic material addressing a wide range of relevant contemporary and cultural themes

272A5271890E4C879B75CAD3A7A4A24A.description: identify the overall message, key points, details and opinions in a variety of short and longer spoken passages, involving some more complex language, recognising the relationship between past, present and future events

570990FD88D04428ABA9159981C2F917.description: follow and understand clear standard speech using familiar language across a range of specified contexts

E8E551872AAD49B28012DFC3B002C17B.description: demonstrate general and specific understanding of different types of spoken language

30BA8F097FC443E68A9EB6764043B71E.description: Listening: Understand and Respond to Spoken Language

46FD7D71AABD4493A9566F5DFB4307D9.description: Topic 4: Jobs, Career Choices and Ambitions

59DF9F1CF765447EA6C28CEDC943F880.description: Topic 2: Life at School and College

5371110E21CD42DA95073E87DCACC064.description: Theme 3: Current and Future Study and Employment

FFAA351C571D47D0B10F25A7110BBAEC.description: Topic 1: Home, Town, Neighbourhood and Region

4559A66E746D4B81A9E28A2051A9DAE0.description: Theme 2: Local, national, international and global areas of interest

88845EB7A6D847C98D31A08174295586.description: Topic 4: Customs and festivals in German-speaking countries/communities

5D18869C3C7F49FA9F910A9F2D9AC9FA.description: Topic 1: Me, my Family and Friends
